shows.title: Ancient Mysteries / Encounters with Monsters
shows.first_half: Historian David Miano discussed ancient civilizations and how archaeologists investigate them. Followed by director Peter von Puttkamer, who shared monster tales drawn from more than 35 years of exploration and encounters.

shows.title: UFO Roundtable: 2025 in Review
shows.guests: Andy McGrillen, Jeremy Corbell, Joe Murgia, Danny Silva, Ryan Robbins
shows.first_half: Join George Knapp and his special guests for this end-of-the-year roundtable and UFO wrap-up as they discuss the events that have happened this year, the state of disclosure, and where ufology is headed in 2026 and beyond. In the first half, podcaster Andy McGrillen and filmmaker Jeremy Corbell will discuss the UFO landscape and why it has never been more exciting. Then, in the latter half, researchers Joe Murgia, Danny Silva, and Ryan Robbins will participate in a panel discussion.

shows.title: Interstellar Objects / Spiritual Guidance
shows.first_half: First Half: Astrophysicist Avi Loeb discusses his research into mysterious interstellar objects such as 3I/ATLAS, and the Galileo Project, a scientific initiative searching for evidence of extraterrestrial technology.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Spiritual teacher and coach Roger Burnley, who has gleaned insights through channeling sessions with a collective consciousness known as Wilhlem, will offer guidance on how to be the best we can be in the coming year and beyond. He'll share his research and documented system for people to move beyond their limitations.

shows.title: Planet X in 2026 / Niagara Hauntings
shows.first_half: First Half: Researcher and author Marshall Masters will bring us his research on Planet X, which he believes is a "Nemesis" mini-constellation in orbit around our sun. He'll describe its orbit and why he contends it will become the largest object in the sky in 2026.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author, producer, and director Peter Sacco will discuss his work in the paranormal field, and his Niagara’s Most Haunted film and Paranormal Profilers TV series. He'll delve into the many hauntings and poltergeists in the Niagara area, and his involvement as a former criminal psychology professor in a 1970 poltergeist case.

shows.title: Psychic Insights for 2026
shows.guests: Erika Gabriel, James Van Praagh, Mark Nelson, Karyn Reece
shows.first_half: Join us on this New Year’s Eve special as four psychics and mediums share their insights and give us their takes and predictions on what 2026 has in store for humankind. In order of appearance: Erika Gabriel, James Van Praagh, Mark Christopher Nelson, and Karyn Reece.

shows.title: AI: Issues & Innovations / Mindset for Success
shows.first_half: First Half: Bart Kosko is a USC Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering and an artificial intelligence researcher. He'll report on how some AI systems may fight back if you try to erase them, AI's growing legal problems and datacenter demands, and the latest on AI servants that search and learn on your behalf.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Licensed psychotherapist and addictions counselor Donna Marks will discuss ways we can improve our lives and establish the mindset needed to succeed. She'll also help us to keep our New Year’s resolutions and explain why some goals are more challenging than others.

shows.title: UFO Investigations / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Alejandro Rojas, a consultant for Enigma Labs —the pioneering data, research, and community platform focused on Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena— joins George Noory to explore the future of UFO investigation. He’ll break down how the Enigma UFO reporting app is transforming public engagement, reveal compelling trends from the latest reports, and examine clusters of sightings, including those near nuclear facilities. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
